The National Assessment for School Heads (NASH), formerly known as the National Qualifying Examination for School Heads (NQESH), is a developmental assessment tool designed to evaluate the readiness of aspiring school heads and identify areas for improvement.  Unlike NQESH, which served primarily as a qualifying exam, NASH measures an individual’s competency level to determine whether they are prepared for a school leadership role or need targeted interventions before assuming the position. It also helps participants gain insights into their strengths, which may indicate a stronger alignment with the teaching track rather than school leadership

Accomplishment Description: Pursuant to DepEd Memorandum No. 068, s. 2025, dated August 11, 2025, which serves as an addendum to DepEd Memorandum No. 014, s. 2022, titled “The DepEd Quality Management System Manual, Procedures, and Work Instructions Manual (PAWIM),” the Department of Education seeks to standardize and harmonize the implementation of a quality‑driven workplace across all organizational levels. This issuance establishes uniform workplace standards and provides for an objective evaluation of their effectiveness, thereby promoting and sustaining quality working conditions in DepEd offices and schools.
Milestone Title: Training for the NQMS Quality Workplace Team - Batch 1
Milestone Description:
The training aims to deepen participants’ understanding of quality workplace concepts, principles, and tools through structured calibration sessions designed to ensure consistent and effective application across all offices and schools. It further provides an orientation on the approved PAWIM for Quality Workplace to ensure uniform interpretation and implementation of established standards.

Additionally, the training facilitates the development of a comprehensive Quality Workplace Sustainability Plan that outlines the essential steps, timelines, and key milestones for the effective implementation and long-term maintenance of Quality Workplace Standards. Milestone Title: Workshop on Redefining Job Roles of CO Related Teaching Positions (Batch 1)
Milestone Description:
DepEd Order No. 019, s. 2022 establishes the Department of Education Merit Selection Plan (MSP) as a tailored policy to operationalize the of merit, fitness, and equality within the department. It underscores the importance of job descriptions in facilitating the screening and evaluation of applicants, ensuring that only candidates meeting the established standards are selected for teaching, related-teaching, and non-teaching positions. 

DepEd has ongoing effort to revise the Qualification Standards of related teaching positions to address the gaps on recruitment and selection, improve clarity, consistency and relevance of roles and function within and across DepEd governance level.  JDs are essential components in the revision of the QS for related teaching positions across DepEd. In order to facilitate the expedite approval of the revised QS by the CSC, all related teaching positions must be submitted concurrently. 

Hence, BHROD-OED conducted two batches of Workshop on Redefining Job Roles of Central Office Related Teaching Positions.  Development and enhancement of these JDs in the CO necessitated the active participation of selected incumbents of related teaching positions particularly those assigned in the bureaus under the CT Strand, BLSS, BEA, NEAP, Policy and Planning Service and PMS.
